DOC.HEAD: Santa Cop and Helper Collar Two Alleged Burglars
DOC.TEXT: Santa had a bit of trouble drawing his gun from his costume but had no problem giving away a couple pairs of stiff bracelets. ``Santa knows who's naughty and nice,'' police Sgt. Don Lacher told David Villalobos, 26, as he stepped on his ankle during the arrest Wednesday. ``I said: `Look, Santa says lay down on the ground.''' Lacher, 35, was dressed as Santa and on his way to a gift giveaway when he got a burglary call over his patrol car radio. Lacher and his uniformed partner, Officer Anthony Trout, rushed to an apartment complex where they found a man and a woman loading a car with nearly $2,000 worth of suspected stolen goods. The pair arrested Villalobos and Anna Marie Gallegos, 29, both of Pomona, for investigation of burglary and possession of a loaded firearm.
